title: Cynthia Erivo and Janelle Monae dazzle in designer gowns at Harriet premiere in LA
text:
Advertisement

They star together in a new biopic about famed American Abolitionist Harriet Tubman.

And on Tuesday night, Cynthia Erivo and Janelle Monae went all out in the fashion stakes at the Los Angeles premiere for the movie that's simply titled Harriet.

Erivo, 32, was striking in a Marc Jacobs while Monae, 33, was jaw-dropping in a very low-cut number by Honayda.

In the spotlight: Cynthia Erivo and Janelle Monae went all out in the fashion stakes at the Los Angeles premiere for their new movie Harriet on Tuesday night

British-born Erivo stars in the title role of Harriet Tubman.

For her big night in Hollywood, the actress opted for the colorful red, orange and pink ostrich-feather gown from designer Jacobs' Spring/Summer 2019 Collection.

It had half sleeves and a full skirt that formed a train behind her as she posed for photos.

Erivo's buzz cut was tinted light green on top and she accessorized with several statement earrings.

Striking: British-born Erivo stars in the title role of American Abolitonist Harriet Tubman and she turned heads in a vibrant red, orange and pink ostrich-feather gown by Marc Jacobs

Looking good: Erivo's buzz cut was tinted light green on top and she accessorized with several statement earrings

Big night: Her designer gown had half sleeves and a full skirt that formed a train behind her as she posed for photos. Harriet marks Erivo's first leading role in a Hollywood movie

Erivo made her name in the role of Celie in the Broadway revival of The Color Purple for which she won a Tony Award in 2016.

Last year, she appeared in two Hollywood movies - Widows and Bad Times at the El Royale.

The lead in Harriet, which is directed by Kasi Lemmons, marks Erivo's first starring role on the big screen.

Funny: Erivo, 32, and Monae, 33, hammed it up for the cameras as they posed together on the red carpet

Monae is a singer and actress who made her name in film with two breakout roles in 2016 - Hidden Figures and Moonlight.

She left little to the imagination in her backless dress with its plunging neckline.

The sheer black fabric featured silver embroidered detailing and floor-length slit sleeves.

Monae added silver sandal heels and wore her hair piled high on top of her head.

She completed her look with large pendant earrings and hot pink lip color.

Dared to bare: Monae left little to the imagination in her backless dress with plunging neckline. The sheer black fabric featured silver embroidered detailing and floor-length slit sleeves

Headturner: She added silver sandal heels and wore her hair piled high on top of her head. She completed her look with large pendant earrings and hot pink lip color

Made an entrance: Monae is a singer and actress who made her name in film with two breakout roles in 2016 - Hidden Figures and Moonlight

Several of the supporting cast, including Joe Alwyn, Henry Hunter Hall and Vanessa Bell Calloway, also showed up for the premiere.

Henry Hunter Hall, 23, is the actor son of director Lemmons and her husband, actor and director Vondie Curtis-Hall.

He had a part in his mom's 2013 film Black Nativity and was in Ava DuVernay's Netflix mini series When They See Us.

He wore a colorful shirt under a black tailored jacket with skinny black pants and brown shoes.

Joe Alwyn, 28, who had pivotal roles in the 2018 films Mary Queen of Scots, Boy Erased and The Favourite, is also in Harriet.

The London-born actor looked dapper in a maroon two-piece suit paired with a black shirt and shoes and an orange tie.

Cast by mom: Henry Hunter Hall, 23, the actor son of director Lemmons and her husband, actor and director Vondie Curtis-Hall, has a supporting role in Harriet

Flare for fashion: London-born actor Joe Alwyn, 28, is also in Harriet and looked dapper in a maroon two-piece suit paired with a black shirt and shoes and an orange tie

Catching up: Alwyn and Hall seemed delighted to see each other again

Supporting role: Vanessa Bell Calloway, 62, chose a gray gown with revealing bodice and a gold-decorated sheer overlay and sheer Bishop sleeves

Tubman was a former slave who, after escaping herself, continued to help other slaves to freedom via the so-called Underground Railroad in the mid-19th century.

She continued her anti-slavery activism during the Civil War after which she returned to property she owned in Auburn, New York, where she cared for her elderly parents.

She died in 1913.

The film Harriet opens in theatres in North America on Friday.

Guests: Kendrick Sampson, 31, looked sharp in a dark red suit and colorful shirt, left, as Colman Domingo, 49, was casual in black sweats with windbreaker and white trainers, right

Leggy look: Canadian actress Hayley Law, 26, whose credits include Riverdale and Altered Carbon, was on trend in a red satin wrap mini dress tied with a sash at the waist
description: The two actresses star in the biopic about American Abolitionist Harriet Tubman which is directed by Kasi Lemmons.
